marketNews.title: Petronas plans aggressive expansion in Indonesia
marketNews.content: Petronas Indonesia head Yuzaini Md Yusof said the company plans to expand aggressively in Indonesia, without specifying a definitive investment amount. Yusof mentioned that Petronas intends to build a hub for its three operating regions in East Java, linking production facilities and logistics facilities. He also said the company has a long-term plan to broaden its business portfolio in eastern Indonesia.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo Subianto scheduled visits to China, United States, Peru, Brazil and United Kingdom
marketNews.content: Kompas reported that President Prabowo Subianto will make state visits to China and the United States between 8 and 24 November 2024. According to information gathered by Kompas from the Presidential Palace, Prabowo will meet President Xi Jinping, Premier Li Qiang and the Chinese Communist Party in Beijing. He will then travel to Washington DC to meet President Joe Biden at the White House. The newspaper added that cooperation and efforts to improve welfare of each country will be central issues during the visits. In addition to China and the US, Prabowo will travel to Peru to attend the APEC Economic Cooperation summit, to Brazil for the G20 summit, and to the United Kingdom to meet King Charles and Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

marketNews.title: Deputy Finance Minister Anggito Abimanyu announces plan to tax underground economy
marketNews.content: Deputy Finance Minister Anggito Abimanyu said President Prabowo Subianto plans to target the underground economy – including online gambling and online games – as a new tax object. Anggito explained that a personal income tax scheme for underground economic activities is being formulated by the government, without specifying when the regulation will be released.

marketNews.title: Indonesian Workers' Union President Said Iqbal to protest Constitutional Court ruling
marketNews.content: President of the Confederation of Indonesian Workers' Unions, Said Iqbal, said his organization will demonstrate in front of the Constitutional Court building in Jakarta on Thursday (31/10) to guard the decision related to the material test of Law No. 6 of 2023 on Job Creation. Iqbal mentioned that more than 1,000 workers from 60 union federations will participate. Demonstrations will also be held in front of provincial governor offices on the same day, with an estimated total of over 20,000 participants.

marketNews.title: Deputy Labor Minister Gerungan assures no layoffs from SRIL bankruptcy
marketNews.content: Deputy Minister of Labor Immanuel Ebenezer Gerungan said the government guarantees that the bankruptcy of Sri Rejeki Isman (SRIL) will not lead to layoffs for its approximately 50,000 employees. The Ministry of Labor claimed that SRIL does not intend to close its factories and will focus on continuing operations because its business and financial conditions have shown signs of recovery over the past several years.

tickerNews.title: Mayora Indah 3Q24: Net loss from currency and margin pressure, below expectations
tickerNews.content: Mayora Indah recorded a low net profit for 3Q24 of 298 billion rupiah (down 63 percent year over year, down 51 percent quarter over quarter). This result kept the net profit for the first nine months of 2024 relatively stable at 2 trillion rupiah (down 1 percent YoY). We assess the achievement as below expectations because it equals only 60 percent of the FY24 consensus net profit estimate. By comparison, Mayora's net profit for 9M23 was 63 percent of FY23 net profit. Currency loss due to rupiah strengthening: Net profit for 3Q24 was also pressured by a net foreign exchange loss of 257 billion rupiah (3Q23: profit 33 billion rupiah, 2Q24: profit 98 billion rupiah). This was caused by the rupiah strengthening against the US dollar to about 15,100 per dollar at the end of September 2024. Mayora holds net cash in US dollars of about 280 million dollars at the end of September 2024, so the company will incur a currency loss when the US dollar weakens against the rupiah. Operating profit pressure from lower gross margin and higher opex: Operating profit was recorded at 726 billion rupiah in 3Q24 (down 31 percent YoY, up 5 percent QoQ). This made operating profit for 9M24 2.7 trillion rupiah (down 2 percent YoY), slightly below expectations at 63 percent of the FY24 consensus estimate (vs. 9M23: 65 percent of FY23). The weak operating profit in 3Q24 was mainly caused by: 1) continued pressure on cocoa and coffee raw material prices affecting gross margin; and 2) increased opex. Gross margin fell to 20.5 percent in 3Q24 (vs. 3Q23: 26.9 percent, 2Q24: 23.5 percent), marking a decline for two consecutive quarters. This pushed the gross margin for 9M24 down to 23.9 percent (vs. 9M23: 26.7 percent), raising the risk that FY24 gross margin will be below management guidance that targets a minimum of 25 percent. With continued pressure on gross margin, Mayora is likely to execute a plan to raise product selling prices for the remainder of the year. Management will hold an earnings call on 5 November 2024, focusing on the company's gross margin dynamics. We consider gross margin the main issue for Mayora, as revenue grew solidly to 9.4 trillion rupiah in 3Q24 (up 17 percent YoY, up 26 percent QoQ). This growth lifted 9M24 revenue by 12 percent YoY to 25.6 trillion rupiah, in line with the new guidance of 10-12 percent growth. Meanwhile, opex increased, especially in general and administrative expenses (up 29 percent YoY, up 15 percent QoQ) together with a surge in salary expenses (up 21 percent YoY, up 17 percent QoQ). We anticipate this cost increase is related to the opening of two new factories. Key Takeaway: Although Mayora may reverse its currency loss in 4Q24 as the US dollar weakens, we view the company's ability to address gross margin challenges as the key factor for its stock movement, given that cocoa and chocolate raw material prices remain relatively high.

tickerNews.title: Erajaya Swasembada 9M24 net profit +60% YoY, exceeds expectations
tickerNews.content: Erajaya Swasembada recorded net profit of 268 billion rupiah (up 640 percent YoY, unchanged QoQ) in 3Q24. This made net profit for the first nine months of 2024 791 billion rupiah (up 60 percent YoY), surpassing expectations at 83 percent of the FY24 consensus estimate. By comparison, ERAA's net profit for 9M23 was 60 percent of FY23 net profit. The increase in 3Q24 net profit was driven by: 1) revenue growth (up 11 percent YoY, down 6 percent QoQ); 2) gross profit margin expansion to 12 percent (up 191 basis points YoY, up 145 basis points QoQ); and 3) other income growth due to promotion support increasing to 60 billion rupiah (vs. 3Q23: 5 billion rupiah), which raised operating profit by 119 percent YoY to 520 billion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: Bumi Resources Minerals reports 45,366 oz gold production in 9M24, 176% YoY
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Bumi Resources Minerals, Agoes Projosasmito, said the company produced 45,366 ounces of gold in the first nine months of 2024, up 176 percent YoY, exceeding the 2024 target of 35,000 ounces and the 2023 realization of 23,270 ounces. The average selling price reached $2,347 per ounce, up 23 percent YoY during 9M24. Agoes noted that the 3Q24 financial statements are still under audit as the company plans to obtain a bank loan, expected in 1Q25, to fund underground mine development in Palu, Central Sulawesi, in 2Q25.

tickerNews.title: Pakuwon Jati 9M24 net profit 816 billion rupiah, +110% YoY
tickerNews.content: Pakuwon Jati recorded net profit of 816 billion rupiah (up 110 percent YoY, up 58 percent QoQ) in 3Q24. This made net profit for the first nine months of 2024 about 1.7 trillion rupiah (up 12 percent YoY), equal to 79 percent of the FY24 consensus estimate. Operationally, revenue fell (down 9 percent YoY, down 12 percent QoQ) in 3Q24, mainly due to a decline in the Property Development segment (down 63 percent YoY, down 65 percent QoQ). This caused operating profit in 3Q24 to drop to 658 billion rupiah (down 7 percent YoY, down 16 percent QoQ). Nevertheless, operating profit for 9M24 grew to 2.1 trillion rupiah (up 7 percent YoY), matching expectations at 74 percent of the FY24 consensus estimate. The surge in PWON's 3Q24 net profit was driven by a currency gain of 375 billion rupiah, reversing a loss of 170 billion rupiah in 2Q24 and 157 billion rupiah in 3Q23.

tickerNews.title: Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna 9M24 net profit 1.9 trillion rupiah, -22% YoY
tickerNews.content: Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna recorded net profit of 1.9 trillion rupiah (down 22 percent YoY, down 78 percent QoQ) in 3Q24. This made net profit for the first nine months of 2024 5.2 trillion rupiah (down 16 percent YoY), below expectations at 69 percent of the FY24 consensus estimate. By comparison, HMSP's net profit for 9M23 was 77 percent of FY23 net profit. The decline in 3Q24 net profit was caused by a 9 percent YoY drop in sales volume and a 20 basis point YoY reduction in gross margin, although the average selling price rose 8 percent YoY. Operating expenses rose 8 percent YoY in 3Q24, with advertising and promotion costs jumping 21 percent YoY, leading to operating profit of 2.4 trillion rupiah (down 12 percent YoY).

tickerNews.title: Adaro Minerals Indonesia 9M24 net profit 84 million USD, -37% QoQ
tickerNews.content: Adaro Minerals Indonesia recorded net profit of 84 million US dollars (down 37 percent QoQ, down 3 percent YoY) in 3Q24. This made net profit for the first nine months of 2024 333 million US dollars (up 33 percent YoY), equal to 76.5 percent of the FY24 consensus estimate. The decline in 3Q24 net profit was caused by a 30 percent QoQ drop in revenue (down 9 percent YoY), which was deeper than the 20 percent QoQ decline in cost of goods sold (down 3 percent YoY), resulting in gross margin falling to 45.6 percent (vs. 3Q23: 49.1 percent, 2Q24: 52 percent).

tickerNews.title: Bank Syariah Indonesia 9M24 net profit 1.7 trillion rupiah, +1.5% QoQ
tickerNews.content: Bank Syariah Indonesia recorded net profit of 1.7 trillion rupiah (up 1.5 percent QoQ, up 24 percent YoY) in 3Q24. This made net profit for the first nine months of 2024 5.1 trillion rupiah (up 22 percent YoY), equal to 75 percent of the FY24 consensus estimate. The 3Q24 net profit was driven by a significant increase in other operating income (+16 percent QoQ, +35 percent YoY), bringing other operating income for 9M24 to 3.2 trillion rupiah (up 33 percent YoY). Additionally, provision expenses eased (-4.1 percent QoQ, -4 percent YoY), reducing provisions for 9M24 to 1.7 trillion rupiah (down 25 percent YoY). On the top line, net profit sharing revenue grew to 4.7 trillion rupiah (up 6.2 percent QoQ, up 8 percent YoY) in 3Q24, resulting in net profit sharing revenue of 13.5 trillion rupiah for 9M24 (up 4.6 percent YoY).

tickerNews.title: Sarana Menara Nusantara announces rights issue with DIA as standby buyer
tickerNews.content: Sarana Menara Nusantara announced that PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan (DIA) will act as a standby buyer in the rights issue the company will conduct. DIA is a holding investment company owned by Robert Budi Hartono and Bambang Hartono. Previously, TOWR announced a rights issue of up to 5 billion new shares with a ratio of 1.001:100 and a dilution effect of up to 9.08 percent. The execution price of the rights issue is 900 rupiah per share, potentially raising 4.5 trillion rupiah. The proceeds will be used to repay loans and for working capital of the company and/or its subsidiary PT Profesional Telekomunikasi Indonesia. The cum right will be traded on the regular market and negotiated on 12 December 2024.

tickerNews.title: Dayamitra Telekomunikasi 9M24 net profit 468 billion rupiah, +15% YoY
tickerNews.content: Dayamitra Telekomunikasi recorded net profit of 468 billion rupiah (up 15 percent YoY, down 14 percent QoQ) in 3Q24. This made net profit for the first nine months of 2024 1.5 trillion rupiah (up 7 percent YoY), slightly below expectations at 70 percent of the FY24 consensus estimate. The below-expectation result was caused by a 74 percent YoY decline in other income to 45 billion rupiah and a 16 percent YoY increase in tax expense. Operationally, operating profit in 3Q24 reached 1 trillion rupiah (up 18 percent YoY, up 3 percent QoQ), leading to operating profit for 9M24 of 3.1 trillion rupiah (up 15 percent YoY), matching expectations at 73 percent of the FY24 consensus estimate.

tickerNews.title: Astra Otoparts 9M24 net profit 515 billion rupiah, +2% YoY
tickerNews.content: Astra Otoparts recorded net profit of 515 billion rupiah (up 2 percent YoY, down 5 percent QoQ) in 3Q24. This made net profit for the first nine months of 2024 1.5 trillion rupiah (up 17 percent YoY). The lower annual growth in 3Q24 compared with 1H24 (+26 percent YoY) was due to a lower increase in other income. Operating profit was 304 billion rupiah (down 9 percent YoY, up 37 percent QoQ) in 3Q24, resulting in operating profit for 9M24 of 793 billion rupiah (down 7 percent YoY).

tickerNews.title: Puradelta Lestari 9M24 net profit 320 billion rupiah, -27% QoQ
tickerNews.content: Puradelta Lestari recorded net profit of 320 billion rupiah (down 27 percent QoQ) in 3Q24, a jump of almost 39 times compared with 3Q23 net profit of 8 billion rupiah. This made net profit for the first nine months of 2024 1.1 trillion rupiah (up 85 percent YoY), equal to 91 percent of the FY24 consensus estimate. The surge in 3Q24 net profit was driven by a low-base effect as revenue recognition in 3Q23 was low (3Q24 revenue 485 billion rupiah). Revenue for 9M24 reached 1.7 trillion rupiah (up 72 percent YoY), equal to 93.6 percent / 87 percent of the company's target/consensus.

tickerNews.title: Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat 9M24 net profit 272 billion rupiah, +17% YoY
tickerNews.content: Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat recorded net profit of 272 billion rupiah (up 17 percent YoY, down 13 percent QoQ) in 3Q24. This made net profit for the first nine months of 2024 873 billion rupiah (up 27 percent YoY), equal to 74 percent of the FY24 consensus estimate. The increase in 9M24 net profit was driven by a 5.3 percent YoY rise in revenue and an expansion of gross margin to 53.4 percent (up 320 basis points YoY).

tickerNews.title: Ecocare Indo Pasifik 9M24 net profit 5 billion rupiah, +7% YoY
tickerNews.content: Ecocare Indo Pasifik recorded net profit of 5 billion rupiah (up 7 percent YoY, up 25 percent QoQ) in 3Q24. This made net profit for the first nine months of 2024 10.3 billion rupiah (down 5 percent YoY). The decline in 9M24 net profit was caused by a 41 percent YoY drop in other income to 2.7 billion rupiah. Operationally, revenue grew 27 percent YoY (up 0.3 percent QoQ) in 3Q24, but cost of goods sold grew faster (up 41 percent YoY and up 1.4 percent QoQ) following expansion into new markets, resulting in gross margin falling to 36.8 percent (down 640 basis points YoY, down 70 basis points QoQ).

tickerNews.title: Jhonlin Agro Raya receives investment credit of 1.4 trillion rupiah from Bank Mandiri
tickerNews.content: Jhonlin Agro Raya obtained an investment credit of up to 1.4 trillion rupiah from Bank Mandiri. The credit term is 96 months and is intended for refinancing.

tickerNews.title: Superior Prima Sukses shareholder PT Tancorp Investama Mulia buys 73.2 million BLES shares
tickerNews.content: Shareholder of Superior Prima Sukses, PT Tancorp Investama Mulia, purchased 73.2 million BLES shares at an average price of 241.6 rupiah per share between 17 and 24 October 2024. The total transaction value was approximately 17.7 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Tancorp Investama Mulia's ownership in BLES increased from 10.3 percent to 11.1 percent.
